title: PHPdefined()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPdefined()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Check if a constant exists:
<?php
define("GREETING","Hello you! How are you today?");
echo defined("GREETING");
?>

Definition and Usage
The defined() function checks whether a constant exists.
Syntax
defined(
name
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
name
Required. Specifies the name of the constant to check
Technical Details
Return Value:
Returns TRUE if the constant exists, or FALSE otherwise
PHP Version:
4+

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
define("GREETING","Hello you! How are you today?");
echo defined("GREETING");
?>

practice_exercises.title: Complete the Code 1
practice_exercises.description: Fill in the missing line to make this code work.
practice_exercises.starter_code:
<?php
# TODO: Complete this line
echo defined("GREETING");
?>
practice_exercises.solution:
<?php
define("GREETING","Hello you! How are you today?");
echo defined("GREETING");
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPdefined()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPdefined()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPdefined()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
